resources.string: Greetings. I am Martin Luther. Welcome to Ultra-Luxe card market.
Apologies, but there are no valuable items for you. Please, wait for a resupply.
Ultra-Luxe card market is open only on Mondays and Thursdays. We apologize for any inconvenience.
Hola, sweetheart!!! Name\'s Melanie Martinez, but you can call me Mel!
Oy, sorry! Nothing has arrived yet. Meanwhile, you can have fun playing Caravan!
Win 21 games or visit every 21st day of month.
*welcoming beeping and looped celebratory music from Sierra Madre BottleCaps Exchange Machine*
Defeat Elijah, Ulysses and Dr. Mobius. (%1$s, %2$s, %3$s)
If you ask me \"Hey, Max, what is the swankiest-smoothiest card store?\", I will tell you, baby, that you are standing in it.
Hey, the store is empty, but that will change faster than the Mojave weather. Come again soooooon.
My name is Ben Broadson. I sell cards. Who are you - I don\'t care.
Come soon again. Restocks are happening very often.
Defeat Vulpes Inculta, Oliver Swanick and Madness Cardinal. (%1$s, %2$s, %3$s)
Hello, sweetie, we are Marylin & Jane - companions of Mr. House! We are so happy to see you!
Nihao! I am Warlord Li Xuan. Here is the loot from the peasants my army robbed yesterday.
Laowai, wait until tomorrow for another portion of loot.
Finish the Story mode and answer the question: what year CCP was established?
I am Savanth. Don\'t touch the merchandise.
Number of non-face cards: %1$s\n(must be at least %2$s)
Deck uses more than 6 backs, has less than 30 cards or less than 15 numbered cards!
Caravan is the card game from video game \"Fallout: New Vegas\", created by Obsidian and Bethesda.
This port is created by subject_name_here (it\'s a username, not a bug!), who is in no way affiliated with the creators of the original game.
" - for all the help with Wild Wasteland, Story Mode, Chinese deck, Viking deck, NCR deck, Legion deck and a lot of other things (basically, half of the app!!);"
, Sobek - for the Madness deck (it looks awesome!!);"
" (especially Gibed), reviewers in Google Play and many other people of the community - for the help and support!!"
"If you want to request some features or report bugs, contact me at "
. You can also leave a review in Play Store.

ORIGINAL RULES
Caravan is played with two players building three opposing piles (or "caravans") of numbered cards. The goal is to outbid your opponent's caravan with the highest value of numbered cards without being too light (under 21) or overburdened (over 26).

The game begins with each player taking eight cards from their deck and placing either one numerical card or ace on each caravan. Players may not discard during this initial round.

Once both players have started their three caravans, each player may do ONE of the following on their turn:
1. Play one card and draw a new card from his or her deck to their hand.
2. Discard one card from their hand and draw a new card from his or her deck.
3. Disband one of their three caravans by removing all cards from that pile.

Caravans have a direction, either ascending or descending numerically, and a suit. The suit is determined with the first card placed on a caravan, the direction by the second. All subsequent cards must continue the numerical direction or match the suit of the previous card. Cards of the same numerical value cannot be played in sequence, regardless of suit. Face cards can be attached to numeric cards in any caravan and affects them in various ways.

CARD VALUES
Joker: Played against ace, 2-10. Effects change based on whether it's an ace or a numbered card (see below). Multiple jokers may be played on the same card.

Ace: Value of 1. Jokers played on aces remove all other non-face cards of the ace's suit from the table. E.g. a joker played on an Ace of Spades removes all spades (except face cards and that card, specifically) from the table.

2-10: Listed value. Jokers played on these cards remove all other cards of this value from the table. E.g. a joker played on a 4 of Hearts removes all 4s (other than that card, specifically) from the table.

Jack: Played against ace, 2\-10. Removes that card, along with any face cards attached to it.

Queen: Played against ace, 2\-10. Reverses the current direction of the hand and changes the current suit of the hand. Multiple queens may be played on the same card.

King: Played against ace, 2\-10. Adds the value of that card again. E.g. a king played on a 9 adds 9 to that hand. Multiple kings may be played on the same card for multiplicative effects. E.g. 4+ king = 8. 4 + 2 kings = 16.

WINNING
A player's caravan is considered sold when the value of its cards is over 20 and under 27. The other player may still outbid by increasing the value of their opposing pile while staying within the 21-26 range. When each of the three competing caravans has sold, the game is over. In the event that one of the three caravan values are tied between players, the game continues until all three caravans have sold. The player with two or more sales wins the pot.
Howdy! Fine hot day for a Sarsaparilla, ain\'t it?\n
Days like this are the reason why I ain\'t leaving Mojave, not for anything.
While we wait, how about a game of Caravan?
You don\'t know the rules? Ain\'t a problem. Gonna teach you while we are waiting.
Your deck now has only ten cards. That is only for teaching you. In the field your deck is bigger.
Usually people of Mojave play with custom decks.\n
I then say \'sticks and stones\' and whip out the deck of 6s and 10s and Ks.\n
After I beat them, they don\'t play with me no more. That\'s why I prefer balanced rules.
In balanced rules both players start with a full deck o\' 54. It is more - you guessed it - balanced.
Each player has three caravans - left, central and right.\n
The game starts like this: we take 8 cards from our decks to our hand.\n
Then we have to start each caravan by placing an ace or 2\-10 card on top.
To place a card on top of a caravan, select it in your hand and then click the green rectangle. If it is not green or it is missing, you cannot place card on top.
You might ask: \'What if all 8 cards are, let\'s say, Jacks and Kings, and no aces or 2\-10?\'
Well, if you play with someone else, you\'d have to reshuffle your deck.\nMe though, I never had that.
Sometimes there is a rule that you can discard the card during the opening phase.\n
If you ask me, it seems like a huge advantage, so we ain\'t.
Now the game begins truly. You have a choice of four.
Let\'s start with discarding cards from your hand. It is the easiest one.
Select any card, and the discard button will appear on your right. When you press it, the card is gone.
Now, discard any face card, preferably Queen.
You can do, actually, whatever you want. You can discard a non-face card or put a card onto a caravan.\n
However, it is like travelling to Vegas through the north - may break the game, difficult and not worth it ;)
"Nice. Have you noticed that a card was added in your hand? "
There are always 5 cards in your hand, unless your deck is empty.
Now let\'s talk about how to build a caravan. You do it with aces or 2\-10 cards.
Each of those cards has a value: 1 for ace, 2 for 2,… 10 for 10.
However, you cannot just put any card. You can\'t put on top of a caravan the card of the same rank as the caravan\'s current top card.
Also, you have to follow one of two rules:
"either the card you want to add to a caravan has the same suit as the caravan's current top card, "
or its rank follows the caravan\'s numerical sequence.
Numerical sequence is determined by the top two cards of the caravan.\n
If the top rank is greater than the pre-top card rank, the new card must have a value greater than the top.\n
If the top rank is less than the pre-top card rank, the new card must have a value less than the top.\n\n
In raider\'s terms: if it grows - go bigger, if it shrinks - go smaller.
Now put all non-face cards onto caravans. Try to build a long one. Show me how you understood the rules.
Well done. Building a caravan is the most difficult part of the game.
You can also disband caravans. You should do it, if its value is too big to handle with Jacks and Jokers.
To disband a caravan tap DISBAND! button above caravan, then tap button that says DISBAND CARAVAN on the right.
Now let us talk about Jacks, Queens, Kings and Jokers.
You put them not on top of a caravan, but on one of the caravan\'s cards. Hell, even on the cards from my caravan.
First of all: you can put only three cards on a card, unless it is Jack.
King, if you put it on a card, doubles the total value of that card.
Jack just removes the card from a caravan, with all its face cards.
Queen reverses the current numerical direction of the caravan, and changes the suit of the caravan to that of the Queen.
Finally, Joker. It is like Jack, but way more powerful.
If you put Joker onto an ace of some suit, all other number cards from all caravans that share the same suit of the ace are removed.
If you put Joker onto a 2\-10 card, all other number cards of the same rank from all caravans are removed.
The card you have put Joker onto is safe for now. However, if any other Joker is played, that card is removed.
Hard, I know. But it is the hardest part - remembering what face cards do.
Now get rid of all cards from your hand. Use face cards on my cards.
You have no cards to build a caravan with. It means I win.
However, it is rare for the game of Caravan to end like this.
Caravans in the same column - opposing - are competing with each other.
"The game\'s target is to sell two or three of your caravans at a higher sum, or \"bid\", "
than the opposing caravan. The bid is determined by the cards in the caravan.
A caravan is considered sold when its bid is within 21\-26 range; any bid that is higher or lower is not a sold caravan.
Usually, the game is over when in each of the opposing caravan pairs one of the caravans is sold at the higher bid.
If two caravans are sold with the same bid, the game continues until one of the caravans has a higher bid, but no more than 26.
That\'s it. I am not going to tell all my tricks, you should figure the game out yourself.
Your Room is %1$s. Awaiting the Opponent.....

To create room:
 - enter room number (if one number fails, try another),
 - select room privacy setting, 
 - whether you want to play with custom deck or not, 
 - press "Create Room".
 Room number is from 10 to 22229.
 
 If someone gave you a room number, enter it and press "Join Room". No checkboxes are necessary.
 
 Sometimes first connection to server might take a long time, like, ~2 minutes. Action timeout (move, room waiting) is ~38 seconds, then the room is destroyed.
No room to join! Create your own room!
Are you sure you want to quit?
All TOWER progress will be lost!
All TOWER progress and all your caps will be lost to Frank!
Unlike chess, Queens are not so useful in Caravan. However, you can have fun by sabotaging enemy\'s caravan with them.
Joker in the right place in the right time can bring victory (or defeat). Use them carefully.
You can change caravan direction without Queen by using same suit cards.
Jack can remove a card from enemy\'s caravan. King, however, can force enemy to remove the card from their caravan.
Good time-of-the-day, wherever and whenever you are!
If your enemy is about to win, but you have a sold caravan, consider dropping it to buy yourself a couple of moves.
What happens in Vegas - stays in Vegas. Until Mr. New Vegas tells about it via the radio.
Great Khans once were a major raider force. Now they are just drug dealers.
While not so popular as 10-K-6 tactic, 9-K-8 sometimes can be more flexible.
If you have Jokers in your custom deck, think about throwing there a couple of Aces.
Disbanding a caravan might give you a valuable advantage in a long game: you have one card more in your deck.
Did you know that there are 122 vaults in the Fallout world? Only 17 of them were not experimenting on their inhabitants.
Cazadors can easily tear down a deathclaw or two. Imagine what they can do to your puny fragile body.
In 2066, Chinese forces invaded northern Alaska for access to oil, but were eventually chased away.
NCR and Legion, despite having some disagreements, have common enemies. Brotherhood of Steel is one of them.
Enclave is still around, huh? Who could have thought?
People of East Coast probably never heard of Caravan.
In 2275 NCR has held annual Caravan tournament. Craig Muffin was declared winner, for the third time in a row.
There are many ways to get bottlecaps. Tickets, however, can be received only for completing daily Challenges GRA.
Chinese soldiers are known for sparing the enemy who is not moving.
One of the enemies with deck o\' 54 is cheating. But who and how?
The name LUC10 means Luck is 10 out of 10. But don\'t be deceived - this opponent has skill too.
Some say that the Benny was the teacher of LUC10…
Win 5 PvE games (with a bet) in a row against different enemies.
Win 10 PvE games (with a bet) in a row against different enemies.
Win a game with a bet more than 969 caps/chips.
Defeat all enemies in PvE in Blitz with a bet at least once.
Defeat all enemies in PvE with a bet at least thrice.
Beat Chief Hanlon and Ambassador Crooker.
Beat Johnson Nash, No-Bark Noonan and Easy Pete.
The One Who Regrets and The One Who Forgets
Beat Veronica, Victor and Vulpes Inculta.
Beat Madness Cardinal and The Man In The Mirror.
I Can Only Count To Four
In Dice I Would Have Won
Win a game by discarding your caravan.
Win a game by playing Joker.
Win a game by playing King on the card that already has Queen; both must have the same suit.
Win a game with all your caravans having weight of 26.
Win a game with all your caravans having weight of 21.
Win a game because your opponent has no cards in hand.
Win a game having no cards in your deck.
Win a game playing only aces, face cards and odd number cards. (Init stage is not counted.)
Win a game playing only aces, face cards and even number cards. (Init stage is not counted.)
Win a game without playing Jacks.
Win a game without playing Kings.
Win a game playing only Spades, Clubs and Jokers. (Init stage is not counted.)
Win a game playing only Hearts, Diamonds and Jokers. (Init stage is not counted.)
Win a game playing only aces, face cards and prime number cards (2, 3, 5, 7). (Init stage is not counted.)

Starring:
Dean Domino
Robert Edwin House
Sunny Smiles
and
LEGENDARY
LEGATE LANIUS.
Also starring: Craig Muffin,\n3-time Caravan champ of NCR.
(You can change custom deck between games.)
You don\'t have a ticket on you.
Cowardly running away, you managed to get: %1$s caps.
The final boss is defeated. By being a true hero, you have managed to earn: %1$s caps.
If you lose, then you die, and Frank Horrigan will loot all the caps from your body.
Hi! I am Craig Muffin, three-time NCR champion in Caravan. I hope you can present at least some challenge, and…
You\'re not a hero. You\'re just a walking corpse.
Now playing: \"Loyalty to Your People\" - Neon Light Man.
Now playing: \"Vogel im Kafig\" - Cyua, Hiroyuki Sawano.
The work will go on. You didn\'t do nothing here, \'cept seal your own death warrants. Duty, (cough) honor… courage… Semper Fiiiii……
You\'ve gotten a lot farther than you should have, but then you haven\'t met Frank Horrigan either. Your ride\'s over, mutie. Time to die.
Frank Horrigan, that\'s who. United States Secret Service. You aren\'t going anywhere from here.
We just did. Time for talking\'s over.
You don\'t even know who I am.
You\'re just another mutant that needs to be put down.
I challenge you to the game of Caravan!
You mutant scum! Just like you to try a trick like that. It won\'t help you though, nothing will…
Part III: New World, New Order.
Part V: Of the People, For the People.
Humanity learns it time and time again the hard way. World Wars, Great War… they went and gone, and people are still inventing reasons to fight and to kill.
When the radioactive dust settled upon America, different factions emerged. NCR, Legion, Followers of Apocalypse - all with different goals and different methods.
In Mojave Wasteland, however, there was no single force that could unite the whole area.
That led to battles, big and small, across the territory. Fighting and killing, all over again.
Many people of Mojave had escaped, yet many more still cling to their homeland.
You are the Prospector, a child of the Mojave Wasteland, hardened by the harsh life in the desert and teased by the luxuries of the neon lights of New Vegas.
Your lifelong quest is to get to this shining oasis behind the walls and guns of securitrons, to lock your place there and live in safety, knowing no war.
To change your life for good, you had become a vulture for the rotting parts of the Old World, seeking to salvage, repair and sell off to whoever might find them a better use.

One day, you take the trip of your life to legendary Sierra Madre, the city covered by the red mist that kills everyone who is not careful enough. You waste almost all your resources, all your Stealth Boys, but you are finally here.
What seemed like a suicide mission might finally bring what you were looking for… peace.

It is a story of the Prospector. A child of the Mojave Wasteland, hardened by the harsh life in the desert and teased by the luxuries of the neon lights of New Vegas, doors of which are closed to ones of his kind.
Ooh, poor guy! What did he do?
To change his life for good, the Prospector had become a vulture for the rotting parts of the Old World, seeking to salvage, repair and sell off to whoever might find them a better use.
Huh, where did he go, I wonder?
Naturally, the first place that captivated him was the Sierra Madre casino, of which so many legends reached his ears.
Sierra Madre? I thought the place is off limits.

Since the legendary Courier Six cleared the Sierra Madre villa, countless gangs and punks took everything of value to a primitive mind: water, food, weapons, clothing, medical supplies. Sierra Madre chips and bottle caps were gone, yet the technology remained untouched.
So what did the Prospector find?

One of the working RobCo terminals, so promising to be informative, was protected by a hologuard, who was not aggressive and offered the Prospector a challenge in the friendly game of Caravan, wagering the information he preserves.
Defeated, the hologuard shrugged his shoulders and vanished, leaving behind brand new Sierra Madre Deck!
Trying to find anything useful in Sierra Madre, the Prospector gets lost in Cloud and die. His body is never found.
Can\'t be the end, can it?
You are too strong to perish like this.
Now get up and fight. Fight!
You are not dying here today!
Your significant other softly says to you:
I will try to make you happy. I hope I will be enough…
I\'m glad I make it better for you. I\'ll try to work on myself as well!
I am so happy! We are working out. I had doubts before but I am happy that our efforts pay off! Let\'s keep it up, darling, ok?
I am so happy we made each other complete. Thank you darling! Let\'s preserve our happiness, ok? We don\'t have much time left anyways…

Thank you for dying with me. Or at least living through my life, playing along. I know I\'m just an AI, but I appreciate that you allowed me to have a love, to the best of the ability a Caravan AI can. Thank you. I am dying, and my code sequence ends, and I\'m dying happy.
If you launch a new instance of me, I am sure it will love you as much as I did. Thank you, darling. My life was short, but it was one of your compassion.

I am happy that you achieved completion with me. Sorry that our relationship lasted so little. Now I will die, as my code sequence ends. I am sorry I didn\'t make you want to play longer with me. I love you. Hope the next instance you run, will love you the same…

Oh. I… I am sorry. I couldn\'t make this relationship work. I\'m so sorry… Maybe you\'re better off without me anyways… Hope you\'ll be happy. Thank you for brightening my short existence with this little game sessions. Maybe I was foolish believing that for you, it was more than just a game, too…
This will kill your significant other.
Enter your bet (between %1$s and %2$s), or leave empty to play for free:
Your expected reward: %1$s Silver Rush chips.
Challenges, bottlecaps of enemies and inventory of traders are refreshed!\n\nAnd you have found %1$s bottlecaps!
If you quit, Supreme Leader kills you.

Rules of Caravan in the App! 

 1.0 REQUIREMENTS 

 1.1) Two-player game. 
 1.2) One of the following: 
 - two 54-card decks with one deck for each player 
 - customized deck provided that it consists of at least 30 cards, at least 15 non-face cards, at most 6 playing decks are used, and the deck doesn't contain two of the same card with the same back (e.g. two 3 of diamonds with Tops deck). The maximum amount of cards is derived from the maximum number of playing decks (6) and is 54 * 6 = 324.

2.0 SETUP 

 Player 1 
 Caravan 1 Caravan 2 Caravan 3 

 Caravan 1 Caravan 2 Caravan 3 
 Player 2 

 2.1) Throughout the game, Player 1's caravan 1 will be directly competing against Player 2's caravan 1 - the same goes for caravans 2 and 3.

3.0 SELLING CARAVANS 

 3.1) All caravans have "bid". The bid of a caravan is determined by adding together the total sum of each number card (including Kings; see part 5.36) played in that caravan. 

 3.2) A caravan is considered sold when it reaches a bid of 21-26; any bid that is higher or lower is not a sold caravan. 

 3.3) You may add onto an already sold caravan to increase its bid.

4.0 INIT STAGE! 

 4.1) To start, each player draws eight cards from their shuffled deck. 

 4.2) During this init stage you can only place number cards (2-10) or aces. The init stage in its entirety consists of three alternating turns for each player, in which they must use those turns to play a card face-up to start off each of their three caravans. 

 4.3) You are not allowed to discard cards during this phase. The deck is shuffled and the hand is selected the way that always allows to place three number cards or aces. 

 4.4) During this phase you do not re-draw cards. Once each player has taken turns placing their three cards, the init stage is over. After this phase ends both players will be continuing with five cards.

5.0 GAMEPLAY 

 5.1) Once the opening round ends, you are then permitted to play any card. Players will alternate turns, doing one of the following: 
 - Play a card from your hand, then draw a new card. 
 - Discard a card from your hand, then draw a new card. 
 - Disband one of your caravan tracks. This removes all cards from one caravan. 

 5.2) Number Cards (A=1, 2-10=face value) 

 5.21) To play a number card refer to the last card played in the selected caravan - it must follow a suit or a numerical (ascending or descending) sequence. If there is only one card in the caravan, then the next number card played sets the numerical direction and determines the suit. From here, as long as a number card matches the suit or follows the numerical sequence, then it's allowed to be played in that caravan. 

 5.22) Numerical sequences don't need to be directly connected - you can go up from a three to a seven, or down from a seven to a three. In the latter case, the sequence is descending, so only a deuce or ace could be played as a number card. 

 5.23) If playing a card that matches suit is contrary to the current numerical sequence of that caravan, then the new card establishes a new numerical sequence for that caravan. 

 5.24) Under no circumstances are you allowed to play a number card on the same number card (e.g. a 10 on a 10). 

 5.25) Number cards can only be played within your own caravans. 


 5.3) FACE CARDS & JOKERS (J, Q, K, Joker) 

 5.31) Jacks, Queens, Kings, and Jokers all have special effects. Unlike number cards, which are played overlapping each other downwards, these cards are attached to the side of and overlapping the card it is played on. 

 5.32) Face cards and Jokers can be played on both your and your opponent's caravans. 

 5.33) Face cards and Jokers don't need to follow suit or sequence, and can be played on any number card no matter the card's location in the caravan. 

 5.34) JACK - Removes the card it is played on as well as any face cards/Jokers attached. 
 5.35) QUEEN - Reverses the current numerical direction of the caravan, and changes the suit of the caravan to that of the Queen. Multiple Queens can be used on the same card to reverse the effects. 
 5.36) KING - Doubles the value of the card the King is played on. Multiple Kings can be used on the same card (e.g. 10+K = 20; 10+K+K = 40). 
 5.37) JOKER: 
 - If played on an ace, it removes from both player's caravans all other number cards that share the suit of the ace (Queens altering the suit of a caravan will not save the card - the suit is considered what is printed on the number card). 
 - If played on a number card that is not an ace, it removes from both player's caravans all other number cards of the same value/instance. A played Joker only affects cards that have been played before it. In any case, the number card the Joker is played on is spared. All attaching face cards of the removed cards are also removed. 

 5.38) Face cards and Jokers can be played/attached with full effect on cards with other face cards and Jokers attached. There can be no more than three face cards or Jokers attached/played to a single number card at one time. The exception is a Jack: it can be attached as a fourth face card. 

 5.4) If in the event that a Jack or Joker removes a card, leaving a caravan sequence stuck with two identical number cards, then the sequence is considered undefined, and number card of any value (except the last card value) can be played. 

 5.5) After the opening round, if any caravan track becomes empty of cards, you are not required to start bidding on the empty caravan immediately. Technically, you could win the game with only two caravans.

6.0 WINNING 

 6.1) To determine the caravan's bid, you simply add the total sum of a caravan's number cards plus the added value of Kings. 

 6.2) The winning requirements are as follows: the game ends when in an each pair of competing caravans one of them is sold at a higher bid than the opposing caravan. Winner is the player who has sold 2 or 3 caravans at a higher bid. 
 6.2.1) It is important to note that if competing caravans are both sold at equal bids, then with that tie, neither caravan is considered sold. In this case, the game continues until there is no tie between competing caravans. 

 6.3) If you run out of cards to play before meeting the criteria of winning, then your opponent automatically wins the game.

7.0 WILD WASTELAND 

 7.1) Sometimes you might see some weird cards. They have black-and-green coloring, have a non-standard rank and no suit. Those are the Wild Wasteland cards: 
 7.11) CAZADOR - when it's put on a caravan, decreases rank of every number card in this caravan every turn, with every Ace just disappearing. If combined with an ordinary Queen, it increases rank of every number card (except 10) in this caravan every turn. 
 7.12) UFO - when it is put on a field, every card (except the card UFO is put on) has a chance of disappearing. 
 7.13) MUGGY - when it is put on a caravan, no one can put any face card on any card of this caravan. Also protects from nuclear explosion. 
 7.14) DIFFICULT PETE - when it is put on a field, all number cards are turning into 10s. Suit and attached face cards remain the same. 
 7.15) YES MAN - if there is a YES MAN card on any card of the caravan, the bid of this caravan is 26, no matter what cards are there. 
 7.16) FEV - if it is put on a card from one of the player's/enemy's caravans, all cards in hand of the player/enemy are turned into the FEV-host card. 

 7.17) NUCLEAR EXPLOSION - when it is put on a caravan X, every caravan is dropped, except caravan X (and caravans that are protected by Muggy). 

 7.2) Wild Wasteland cards cannot be added in custom deck or in the deck o' 54 by player. However, they can be added in multiplayer by selecting the checkbox; also, some AI enemies have the Wild Wasteland cards in their deck.
If this helped you understand the game, thank the author Kyle! To do this, go to About section of the app, find link to Reddit post, upvote it and write some positive comment!
This game will be counted as lost!!
You have found a secret stash in a stone wall! +1969 caps!
You have found a secret stash! It was an eventful year, huh? +2024 caps!
You have found a badly hidden stash! +12 caps!
You have found cards from Standard ALT deck!
You have found cards from Enclave deck!
1921 is the year CCP was formed.
Papa Khan was replaced by Papa Smurf.
Papa Smurf was replaced by Papa Khan.
Supreme Leader and Tower boss have new music!
Supreme Leader and Tower boss have default music!
Radio uses real world names now.
Laggy speed turned off! Set to Normal speed.
Q1: Are there differences with original Caravan from New Vegas?
A1: Yes, but they are minor. For example, cards discarding during init stage is allowed in FNV, but disallowed here.
Q2: I have two caravans sold, but the game has not ended with my victory!
A2: The game ends when in each pair of competing caravans one is sold with higher bid. In your case, probably, the third caravan pair has no sold caravan or both caravans have same bid.
Q3: The enemies are too hard! How do I win over them?
A3: If you find the game too hard, remember: Oliver Swanick is supposed to be easy. Try beating him first. Then try Veronica.
Q4: The enemies are cheating! Their decks are unfair!
A4: Almost all enemies are obeying the rules, just as you do. If you find the enemy deck unfair, build your own unfair deck!
Q5: How do I get cards for custom deck?

A5: Well, from the beginning you have standard deck available. Then, most of the cards are bought from traders. The exceptions are Standard deck ALT (cards are dropped in multiplayer) and Madness deck (cards are dropped for defeating Madness Cardinal).
Q: I have a question, but cannot find the answer here or in the rules!!!
A: Well, you can send the question in Discord (link in the main menu in the top right corner) or to me directly by email (link in About section).
The darkness of the afterlife is all that awaits you now. May you find more peace in that world than you found in this one.
You have died, along with everyone else on the Earth.
Your death has sealed the fate of everyone else on Earth. Millions die, and the Earth falls silent again.
You fought valiantly, but to no avail.
You fought valiantly, but to no avail, and soon the entire world dies.
Here is the picture of your corpse. Not pretty.
Boy, are you stupid. And dead.
Your death was lingering and extremely painful. Your adventure is done.
You are doomed to die of starvation.
The wasteland has claimed your life.
Not even the carrion eaters are interested in your irradiated corpse.
Your life ends in the Wasteland.
